case_vignette:
A 16-year-old man presents to the clinic accompanied by his father, with the complaints of high fever, sore throat, and bloody diarrhea for 4 days. He adds that he is also nauseous and vomited several times in the past 2 days. He denies any recent travel or eating outside. He recently started a dog-walking business. The father relates that two of the dogs had been unwell. His temperature is 37°C (98.6°F), respiratory rate is 16/min, pulse is 77/min, and blood pressure is 100/88 mm Hg. A physical examination is performed and is within normal limits including the abdominal exam. Blood test results are given below:
Hb%: 14 gm/dL
Total count (WBC): 13,100/mm3
Differential count:
Neutrophils: 80%
Lymphocytes: 15%
Monocytes: 5%
question: What is the most likely diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Infectious Diseases. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.

I've been having a high fever, sore throat, and bloody diarrhea for the last 4 days.
Have you had any recent travel or exposure to anyone with a similar illness?
No, I haven't traveled recently or eaten outside, and I haven't been around anyone with similar symptoms.
Have you had any recent changes in your weight or appetite?
No, I haven't mentioned anything about changes in my weight or appetite.
Have you had any recent changes in your sleep patterns or energy levels?
I feel nauseous and have vomited several times, which might suggest changes in my sleep or energy, but I haven't specifically mentioned those changes.
Have you had any recent changes in your menstrual cycle or sexual activity?
I haven't mentioned anything about changes in my menstrual cycle or sexual activity.
Have you had any recent changes in your medication or supplements?
I haven't mentioned taking any medications or supplements recently.
Have you had any recent changes in your work or school environment?
I recently started a dog-walking business.
Have you had any recent changes in your diet or eating habits?
No, I haven't mentioned any changes in my diet or eating habits.
Have you had any recent changes in your stress or anxiety levels?
I haven't mentioned anything about changes in my stress or anxiety levels.
Have you had any recent changes in your family history or medical history?
I haven't mentioned any changes in my family history or medical history.
Final Diagnosis: Inflammatory Bowel Disease (IBD)
